title: Legal Assistant / Executive Administrative Secretary Job at the National Institute of Credit Administration
keyword: the national institute of credit administration
content:
NICA was established by law vide ante Act No. 26 of August 16th, 2022. The Act gives NICA the statutory power and supervisory authority to control, regulate, and set standards for the credit management profession and education in Nigeria; thus, the Institute promote, protect, enhance, and encourage sound credit business management across industries, and other credit management related matters throughout the federation of Nigeria with impact on global credit matters.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Legal Assistant / Executive Administrative Secretary

Job Location: Eti-Osa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Draft, format, and review legal documents including contracts, MoUs, policy documents, and internal regulations.
	Maintain and update the institute’s legal files, case records, and correspondence.
	Serve as the point of contact between the legal unit and other departments, staff, and external legal counsel.
	Organize and schedule meetings, legal consultations, and documentation signings.
	Support legal officers in contract management and ensure timely renewal of agreements.
	Assist with compliance monitoring and ensure adherence to statutory and institutional requirements.
	File and track regulatory documents with government agencies, accreditation bodies, or legal institutions.
	Manage confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
	Assist with the preparation of legal reports and minutes from legal meetings or disciplinary panels.


Requirements


	Must be a fresh graduate who has completed the NYSC program.
	Must have been called to the Nigerian Bar.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their Curriculum Vitae (CV) and cover letter to: registrar@icanigeria.net and copyhr@icanigeria.net using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Procurement Officer Job at Medcourt Pharmacy
content:
Medcourt Pharmacy is a health-care company in Lagos, Nigeria. We offer pharmaceutical services and medical solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Source and negotiate with reliable vendors and suppliers within the pharmaceutical industry.
	Manage inventory levels and ensure timely restocking of products.
	Maintain accurate records of purchases, pricing, and other essential data.
	Collaborate with internal departments to forecast procurement needs.
	Prepare and process purchase orders in accordance with company policies.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements in the procurement of pharmaceutical products.
	Monitor supplier performance and resolve issues related to delivery, quality, or pricing.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor's Degree
	Experience Required: 2 - 3 years of working in procurement within a pharmaceutical company.
	Location: Candidates must reside in Ikeja, Ketu, Gbagada, Berger, or nearby areas.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary
	Health Maintenance Organization (HMO)
	Pension Plan
	Opportunities for growth and professional development


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: beckybrown2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Should be able to resume in 2 weeks time.

title: Transport / Fleet Officer Job at Bond Chemical Industries Limited
content:
Bond Chemical Industries Limited is a pharmaceutical company situated in Awe, Oyo State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Transport / Fleet Officer

Job Location: Awe, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Process vehicle maintenance and efficient record keeping.
	Implement operational standards on vehicles
	Oversee training and induction of new drivers, and allocation of vehicles for official duties
	Keep logistics record (fuel, repairs, car service routine, etc.)

	Proven track record of improving logistics operations, reducing costs
	Coordinate vehicle repairs and routine service

N120,000 - N170,000 monthly.
